page.title: 19FESTIVALS IN TICKHILL
page.content: As well as the usual religious services such as marriage and baptism, there are other times when the community comes together.Harvest is the time in Autumn when people give thanks to God that the crops have been safely gathered in and that there is enough food for the coming year.People bring gifts of food to the decorated church for the Harvest{Festival.}Later the food is distributed to the old people in the community.The Sunday nearest to 11th November is Rememberance Day.Guides,Scouts, Brownies and Cubs parade through Tickhill.There is a{special service and wreaths are laid at the War Memorial.In the summer there is a Flower Festival.The{church}is decorated with pictures on one theme made of flowers.Pictures drawn by children are also put up.
